intro: Xanthophyllum resupinatum, commonly known as the golden star moss, is a type of liverwort found in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is characterized by its delicate, sprawling growth habit. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically bright green and covered in a fine layer of hair. It produces tiny, yellowish spore capsules that are clustered in groups, giving it its common name. Xanthophyllum resupinatum is often found on rocks or decaying wood in temperate regions.
